inventors.name: Nikola Tesla
inventors.description: Nikola Tesla was known for his work on alternating current (AC) and wireless transmission.

inventors.name: Marie Curie
inventors.description: Marie Curie pioneered research on radioactivity and was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize.

inventors.name: Thomas Edison
inventors.description: Thomas Edison was an American inventor and businessman who held 1,093 US patents

inventors.name: Benjamin Franklin
inventors.description: Benjamin Franklin is best known for his inventions like the bifocal glasses, the Franklin stove, and the lightning rod

inventors.name: Alexander Graham Bell
inventors.description: Alexander Graham Bell is primarily known for inventing the telephone. He received a patent for his invention in 1876, which revolutionized communication.

inventors.name: Leonardo da Vinci
inventors.description: Leonardo da Vinci is famous for his remarkable contributions to art, science, and engineering, earning him the title of a Renaissance man.

inventors.name: Tim Berners-Lee
inventors.description: Tim Berners-Lee, a British scientist, invented the World Wide Web (WWW) in 1989, while working at CERN

inventors.name: Clara Barton
inventors.description: Clara Barton is best known as the founder of the American Red Cross and for her work as a Civil War nurse and relief worker.
